alert.note: Alert for Gillespie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 7:44PM CDT until April 20 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gillespie County in south central Texas... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 744 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fredericksburg, Stonewall, Cherry Spring, Crabapple, Enchanted Rock State Natural Area, Doss, Eckert, Willow City and Harper. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
